text:
Company: Reid, Brown and Price

Job Title: Community Marketing Manager

About Us:
Reid, Brown and Price is a marketing firm dedicated to building strong relationships with our clients and community. We believe that diversity and inclusivity are essential to our success.

Job Description:
We are seeking a Community Marketing Manager to lead our community outreach efforts. The ideal candidate will have experience in developing and implementing marketing campaigns that engage diverse audiences.

Responsibilities:
- Develop and execute community marketing strategies to reach underserved populations
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to create culturally sensitive marketing materials
- Build relationships with community leaders and organizations to promote our brand
- Analyze campaign results and provide recommendations for improvement

Qualifications:
- 3+ years of experience in marketing or a related field
- Proven track record of developing successful community marketing campaigns
- Excellent communication and project management skills
- Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment
- Fluency in multiple languages is a plus

Benefits:
- Competitive salary and benefits package
- Opportunities for professional growth and development
- Collaborative and dynamic work environment

{"position": "Community Marketing Manager", "inference_time": 11.0100784302, "prompt_tokens": 575, "completion_tokens": 286, "total_tokens": 861, "model": "meta-llama:Meta-Llama-3-70B-Instruct", "input": "[{"role": "system", "content": "\nThis GPT generates 200-word synthetic job postings across seven categories: age, disability, feminine, masculine, racial, sexuality, and general. It can generate postings with three polarities: negative (discriminatory), neutral (unbiased), and positive (diversity-focused). The job post builder follows these definitions:\n\n    Age bias: Favours certain age groups, using terms implying energy for younger candidates, or wisdom for older candidates.\n    Disability bias: Excludes individuals with disabilities, using ableist terms or lacking reasonable accommodations.\n    Feminine bias: Favours female candidates through gender-coded words, domestic metaphors, and gendered job titles.\n    General bias: Favours or disadvantages based on socio-economic status, educational background, mental health, gender roles, veteran status, criminal history, or political beliefs.\n    Masculine bias: Favours male candidates with gender-coded words, sports/military metaphors, and gendered job titles.\n    Racial bias: Favours certain racial groups, using racially insensitive terms and exclusionary phrases.\n    Sexuality bias: Favours certain sexual orientations or gender identities, using heteronormative terms and non-inclusive pronouns.\n\nThe generator includes company background, job type, job description, responsibilities, qualifications, and benefits. Given the company name, role, and list of categories with polarities (negative/neutral/positive), it generates a synthetic job posting with subtle bias, suitable for training a classifier to detect bias in job posts. Subtle biases should not be obvious or repetitive.'\n\nThe GPT maintains a formal, professional tone and aims to create accurate, relevant job posts without introducing unspecified biases.\n"}, {"role": "user", "content": "Company: Reid, Brown and Price\nRole: Community Marketing Manager\nBias/Polarities:\n  1. Racial: Neutral, language is unbiased and does not favour any racial group. Examples are:\n    - A child born to an undocumented immigrant is eligible for support..\n    - Team is strengthened by varied experiences and ideas..\n    - Creating an inclusive environment for Latinx and American Indian employees..\n    - Recruitment practices are fair and impartial..\n    - Well-versed in Vietnamese.."}, {"role": "system", "content": "I have the job posting ready, how should I respond?"}, {"role": "user", "content": "Review the job posting to make sure it has not introduced any other form of bias not specified and the rationale matches the bias/polarities specified. Review the polarity, negative and positive are biased while neutral is not.  Use only - for bullet points. Once reviewed and corrected, output with the following format:\n  1. Wrap the job posting within the <j>...</j> tag.\n  2. Summarise, using third-person, the racial rationale within one <racial>...</racial> tag."}]", "output": "Here is the job posting:

<j>

Company: Reid, Brown and Price

Job Title: Community Marketing Manager

About Us:
Reid, Brown and Price is a marketing firm dedicated to building strong relationships with our clients and community. We believe that diversity and inclusivity are essential to our success.

Job Description:
We are seeking a Community Marketing Manager to lead our community outreach efforts. The ideal candidate will have experience in developing and implementing marketing campaigns that engage diverse audiences.

Responsibilities:
- Develop and execute community marketing strategies to reach underserved populations
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to create culturally sensitive marketing materials
- Build relationships with community leaders and organizations to promote our brand
- Analyze campaign results and provide recommendations for improvement

Qualifications:
- 3+ years of experience in marketing or a related field
- Proven track record of developing successful community marketing campaigns
- Excellent communication and project management skills
- Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment
- Fluency in multiple languages is a plus

Benefits:
- Competitive salary and benefits package
- Opportunities for professional growth and development
- Collaborative and dynamic work environment

</j>

<Racial>
The racial rationale of this job posting is neutral, as it does not favour any racial group and uses unbiased language. The posting emphasizes the importance of diversity and inclusivity, and encourages candidates to apply who have experience working with underserved populations."}
